channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1938] Creating containers with patches fails
item.description:
Create a fuse gear sometimes fails with

"Command not found: fabric:wait-for-provisioning"

if the fuse cartridge contains a patch.

This happens when the container is joining an existing fabric. My theory is that occurs when the fabric:join command has just been run by the install script and so the container doesn't have the fabric service running at all at the moment, hence the command being not available when the upgrade script attempts to use it.
item.environment: OSE, build 390-5 (currently the latest available build with patches)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Your theory is correct I think https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/faea7441f54c43372cd1f34328f29c78d8979a5f resolves it but will add an additional check in there to be sure.
Added extra check here: https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/c3aa00f41a20904857efae7da3ac002cfb0911f7

Hi Jonathan Anstey , I modify these changes into 390-4 and 390-5. When upgrading from 390-4 to 390-5, it also show this error :"Command not found: fabric:wait-for-provisioning" on node ? is the same issue with this ?

Hmm.. I can't see how it would be possible to get this message if those changes were in place... I mean right before this command is used we wait until the command is available. That wait command will also fail if it can't find it in time... Did you modify the scripts in the cartridge cache at /var/lib/openshift/.cartridge_repository/... ?

I had to add a sleep 1 second in the fabric8 script as it could seldom fail invoking the command.

See our script
https://github.com/fabric8io/fabric8/blob/master/fabric/fabric8-karaf/src/main/append-resources/common/etc/shell.init.script#L18

Thx Claus Ibsen so it isn't only on OpenShift then. The latest cart is now super careful before executing those commands so I think we are set:

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/blob/openshift-enterprise-fuse-rpm-6.1/bin/upgrade#L43-52
Fixed in next build of RPM (396-2 most likely).

I'm uploading some dev RPMs to test out this fix now. Will be available later today at:

Without patch - https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/jboss/fuse/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse/6.1.0.redhat.396-901/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.0.redhat.396-901-fc18.noarch.rpm
With patch - https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/jboss/fuse/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse/6.1.0.redhat.396-902/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.0.redhat.396-902-fc18.noarch.rpm

I am still getting errors during control start when adding openshift containers (from hawt.io) with the openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.0.redhat.399-2-fc18.noarch.rpm 

October 02 08:06:17 INFO Shell command '/sbin/runuser -s /bin/sh 542d3f968db227ca4c0000b8 -c "exec /usr/bin/runcon 'unconfined_u:system_r:openshift_t:s0:c2,c546' /bin/sh -c \"set -e; /var/lib/openshift/542d3f968
 
db227ca4c0000b8/fuse/bin/control start \""' ran. rc=1 out=CLIENT_MESSAGE: empty2 already started
 
CLIENT_MESSAGE: Waiting for container to be provisioned...
 
client: JAVA_HOME not set; results may vary
 
true
 
client: JAVA_HOME not set; results may vary
 
Command not found: fabric:wait-for-provisioning

This has been reproduced on both OS1 internal cloud virtual machines and beaker kick-ass bare-metal nodes, so this isn't the usual timeout / slow machine problem...
Neither of my 10 attempts ended up with a running patched container... they all failed, but not all with the same "Command not found: fabric:wait-for-provisioning" error.

Another type of failure in this scenario:

com.openshift.client.OpenShiftEndpointException: Could not request https://broker.hosts.sample.com/broker/rest/domain/beaker/applications?include=cartridges: Shell command '/sbin/runuser -s /bin/sh 542d45928db227d1c4000065 -c "exec /usr/bin/runcon 'unconfined_u:system_r:openshift_t:s0:c1,c827' /bin/sh -c \"/var/lib/openshift/542d45928db227d1c4000065/fuse/bin/install --version 1.0.0\""' returned an error. rc=1

It seems that the assumption that once "io.fabric8.boot.commands.service.JoinAvailable" is available it stays available is wrong for the patched containers... presumably because they will restart once they have joined the fabric because of the default (patched) profile changes.

I've made some improvements to the upgrade script for cases where manybnodes are patched. I'm uploading a new RPM now but over this crappy hotel wifi it will take all night feel free to copy the new script in to see if it helps:

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/blob/openshift-enterprise-fuse-rpm-6.1/bin/upgrade

I have tried the updated upgrade script with 399-2 and it only works when the container is created via rhc/openshift console. Any attempts to create a container from Fuse (hawtio new openshift container) have failed.

This error when creating an empty container (only the default profile) (log suggests it failed during waiting on or executing

${FUSE_BIN_DIR}/client -h ${OPENSHIFT_FUSE_IP} -u admin -p ${password} "fabric:patch-apply --all-versions file:$\{patch}"

the log:

October 07 02:41:54 INFO openshift-agent: request end: action=cartridge_do, requestid=3cef9a7d3d23542182f9d55076aecb8b, senderid=broker.hosts.sample.com, statuscode=1, data={:time=>nil, :output=>"CLIENT_ERROR: Failed to execute: 'control start' for /var/lib/openshift/54338a578db227f383000190/fuse CLIENT_MESSAGE: empty2 already started CLIENT_MESSAGE: Waiting for patching service to become available... CLIENT_MESSAGE: client: JAVA_HOME not set; results may vary CLIENT_ERROR: 617 [pool-2-thread-2] WARN org.apache.sshd.client.keyverifier.AcceptAllServerKeyVerifier - Server at [/127.4.250.129:23101, DSA, 4c:2a:81:a9:61:00:4b:c5:54:ad:69:dc:87:06:e6:bb] presented unverified {} key: {} CLIENT_ERROR: Killed (core dumped) ", :exitcode=>157, :addtl_params=>nil}

A slightly different error message occurs when I create a container with the "fabric" profile installed (which is by default on those created the "rhc way")

The following log suggests it hangs on or fails somewhere in the "is_fabric_provisioned"

October 07 02:49:31 INFO openshift-agent: request end: action=cartridge_do, requestid=c6b19d3089b152baa2ae75e277779023, senderid=broker.hosts.sample.com, statuscode=1, data={:time=>nil, :output=>"CLIENT_ERROR: Failed to execute: 'control start' for /var/lib/openshift/54338c2a8db227f3830001a4/fuse CLIENT_MESSAGE: fabric2 already started CLIENT_MESSAGE: Waiting for patching service to become available... CLIENT_MESSAGE: client: JAVA_HOME not set; results may vary CLIENT_MESSAGE: true CLIENT_MESSAGE: Patching all profile versions with /var/lib/openshift/54338c2a8db227f3830001a4/fuse//patches/test-ose-patch-6.1.0.redhat-400.zip CLIENT_MESSAGE: client: JAVA_HOME not set; results may vary CLIENT_ERROR: 624 [pool-2-thread-1] WARN org.apache.sshd.client.keyverifier.AcceptAllServerKeyVerifier - Server at [/127.12.119.129:23101, DSA, 9b:81:f8:33:48:2b:fd:16:5b:ab:51:bc:15:4c:4d:5e] presented unverified {} key: {} CLIENT_ERROR: 534 [pool-2-thread-1] WARN org.apache.sshd.client.keyverifier.AcceptAllServerKeyVerifier - Server at [/127.12.119.129:23101, DSA, 9b:81:f8:33:48:2b:fd:16:5b:ab:51:bc:15:4c:4d:5e] presented unverified {} key: {} CLIENT_ERROR: Killed (core dumped) CLIENT_ERROR: /var/lib/openshift/54338c2a8db227f3830001a4/fuse//bin/upgrade: line 57: 1003 Killed sleep 5 ", :exitcode=>157, :addtl_params=>nil}

The second case is likely the same issue as in ENTESB-2038 , OPENSHIFT_FUSE_PASSWORD being empty during 

curl http://admin:${OPENSHIFT_FUSE_PASSWORD}@$OPENSHIFT_FUSE_IP:8080/jolokia/

in is_fabric_provisioned
The first case looks to me a like a conceptual issue with what the upgrade script tries to do, see ENTESB-2052

As mentioned in ENTESB-2052, you made a very good point about the fabric profile not being there on some nodes. I didn't see this yet because I have been testing patching from the command line only and by using "rhc app create" we always have the fabric profile. Investigating a possible solution now.

Made a fix to only patch containers that have the fabric profile. So in the case of these plain containers, it won't wait for 300s for the patch-apply command to become available, so should be much quicker. Change is here:

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/892a46fd5f82720a09405f8043c844b6210bf2eb

Deployed new RPM for testing here:

https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/jboss/fuse/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse/6.1.0.redhat.399-4/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.0.redhat.399-4-fc18.noarch.rpm

I have tried with the updated scripts from current https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/tree/openshift-enterprise-fuse-rpm-6.1

and the remaining issue I sometimes hit is an occasional failure of containers created in hawtio with predefined profile (e.g. example-mq).

October 08 04:36:10 INFO openshift-agent: request end: action=cartridge_do, requestid=e7ec685baca85ad0b4faeea2f95ee46d, senderid=broker.hosts.sample.com, statuscode=1, data={:time=>nil, :output=>"Shell command '/sbin/runuser -s /bin/sh 5434f7558db227f383000269 -c "exec /usr/bin/runcon 'unconfined_u:system_r:openshift_t:s0:c1,c616' /bin/sh -c \"/var/lib/openshift/5434f7558db227f383000269/fuse/bin/install --version 1.0.0\""' returned an error. rc=1

CLIENT_ERROR: 273 [pool-2-thread-2] WARN org.apache.sshd.client.keyverifier.AcceptAllServerKeyVerifier - Server at [/127.3.51.1:23101, DSA, 61:4f:50:a4:6c:26:46:ff:2b:69:36:24:78:1c:70:02] presented unverified {} key: {}
", :exitcode=>157, :addtl_params=>nil}

I suspect that there is a window between "wait-for-service io.fabric8.boot.commands.service.JoinAvailable" being available, and the "fabric:join " call in which the fabric service is being restarted (possibly as the container has just joined the fabirc and discovered that there is a profile it needs to deploy? )

Note that "fabric:join" is not needed to do for openshift containers created by fabric, as they are already joined (or so it seems)

Yes, waiting for the join command to become available and then trying to join in the install script is a waste of time if the app is created from hawtio/fabric8 console. This should be fixed in the next build with:
https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/56572f8423ffaa4cc1a750bf97843572cff44543
https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/503446adfc42b34491fa4ecf1eacf3a8d0cce94d
https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuseenterprise/commit/1da1a03ba9e78576ddd27580ffe75a348e0b4ed1

The example-mq problem is separate. In the latest build I couldn't even get this example to provision (with or without patch). This should be fixed with:
https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/99b933a6586fbd77097548849b8abde82fddc865
https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuse-openshift-cartridge/commit/6fc65dd939dbc0f8c1c9e0ce52b2b824c04f5a35

Currently waiting on a new product build to complete [1] before creating a new patch RPM for testing...

[1] https://jenkins.mw.lab.eng.bos.redhat.com/hudson/view/SOA-Team/view/Fuse_6/job/fuse-team-perfectus-6.1.x-patch/

New RPMs for testing are available:

Without patch - https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/jboss/fuse/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse/6.1.1.redhat.403-1/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-1-el6.noarch.rpm
With patch - https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/jboss/fuse/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse/6.1.1.redhat.403-2/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-2-el6.noarch.rpm

Sorry, i have met this problem, seems this package is broken, Could you help me check it ?
[root@node1 ~]# rpm -U openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-2-el6.noarch.rpm
error: unpacking of archive failed on file /usr/libexec/openshift/cartridges/fuse/usr/system/org/scribe/scribe/1.3.5/scribe-1.3.5.jar;54378b70: cpio: read failed - Bad file descriptor

works for me

$ md5sum openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-1-el6.noarch.rpm openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-2-el6.noarch.rpm
85a16fe9b4a5508f5dc1ca1b3e6a2de5 openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-1-el6.noarch.rpm
2256b8bd9297e221ee7e06490c234c9d openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-2-el6.noarch.rpm
okay, download it again.

In 403-1, the OPENSHIFT_FUSE_CREATED_FROM_FABRIC is not being set. Is it supposed to be in the 403 build, or will it be in the next one? On 403 I am still getting the issue of containers created by fabric failing to install due to invoking of fabric:join in the install script.

Looking at the decompiled fabric-openshift-1.0.0.redhat-403.jar, the https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuseenterprise/commit/1da1a03ba9e78576ddd27580ffe75a348e0b4ed1 change is indeed not there.
Darn, looks like the commit just missed the 403 build. I'll have to generate a new set of RPMs to test this one.

Here is an RPM with a patch for the fabric-openshift module that includes the https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuseenterprise/commit/1da1a03ba9e78576ddd27580ffe75a348e0b4ed1 commit:
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/jboss/fuse/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse/6.1.1.redhat.403-3/openshift-origin-cartridge-fuse-6.1.1.redhat.403-3-el6.noarch.rpm
You should be able to migrate to this RPM from either of the #403 ones before it.
Just checked and fix for join command is in the 406 build https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fuseenterprise/commit/1da1a03ba9e78576ddd27580ffe75a348e0b4ed1

I am testing the 403-3 and sometimes the container created by fabric with the default profile fails to provision with

io.fabric8.agent.utils.MultiException: Error while downloading artifacts

which leads to gear creation failure as the wait for " wait_for_start 'wait-for-fabric' " times out in such cases.

In one case the exception was even weirder

It looks as if there is a race condition in configuring the maven repository to add the fabric maven proxy and the attempt to get the bundles from maven. (if that is the case this issue may also occur for custom bundles and not be patching-specific) I'll try to reproduce the issue without patching.
I have reproduced the problem even with custom bundles, opened ENTESB-2083
Verified on 410 with the patch "test-ose-patch-6.1.1.redhat-904.zip". It still sometimes fails due to https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-2083, which is not strictly patching-specific issue.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. Install an RPM with a patch (such as build 390-5 )
  2. Create a fuse gear from OpenShift console
  3. Create a second fuse gear from OpenShift console
  4. repeat the previous step until it fails with "Command not found: fabric:wait-for-provisioning"
